question: I am 39, and have suffered difficulty breathing, particularly under physical exercise for my entire life.  However, over the last ten years the condition has gotten steadily worse.  I have sought diagonstic assistance from my GP, pulmonologist, cardiologist, and allergist sub-specialists; I am on my 4rth rotation of these individuals--and as yet have not found a useful diagnosis (i.e. one, the treatment of which, actually causes a cessation of  qusymptoms).  My physicians are either at a loss or think I'm off my rocker.  It's been recommended that I go to a specialty hospital for a myriad of tests--but after 39 years I've lost my belief that investing thousands of dollars in another run of tests will do anything more than deflate my bank-account.Symptoms - Shortness of breath, tightness in chest, feeling of fullness, coughing with thick mucus.  Severe fatigue.  Night sweats (I sometimes change my clothes as many as three times a night and have for as long as I can remember).  Exercise intolerance (Heart Rate acceleration, dizziness, spots in front of eyes, nausea, vomiting).  I can not drink alcohol without breathing difficulty, I can't eat any normal meal size of food without difficulty).  I can't go out in heat without breathing difficulty.  I also get a red rash on my face and neck.Asthma - No, tested with methacholine (sp) challengeBrachiatessis (sp) - No, tested with CT ScanSinus infection - No, tested with MRI, multiple scansDiabetes - No, tested 4 years ago.Allergies - Yes, mold and bugs (not mediated by IG-e that's = 10)CH50 is elevatedThings that don't help: Advair, Singular, most antihistamines, albuteralThings that help sometimes: nebulizerThings that help: prednizone, antibiotics, and ibuprofen, the air-vest chest thumpy thing.Any suggestions?
title: Need Advice on what to do
